curam.util.resources
Class Configuration

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.resources.Configuration

public final class Configuration
extends java.lang.Object

Gets application runtime properties. This class encapsulates the application's dependence on runtime property files, command line parameters, system settings, and so on.

Properties are name/value pairs in the format defined by java.util.Properties. The order in which settings are determined is:

  • a) by looking up System properties. (These in turn can be overridden on the command line by using the java -D option.
  • b) by looking up the properties listed on the database.
  • c) by looking up the specified the default property file Bootstrap.properties.

    If a property is not found a debug message is written as a trace record.

    Method Detail

    getProperty

    public static java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String key)
    Gets a runtime property from the property cache.

    Parameters:
    key - The name of the property to be looked up.
    Returns:
    The property value with white space trimmed from the left and right hand side. Null is returned if the property does not exist, or if it exists but has nothing assigned to it.
    See Also:
    Configuration.setProperty(String, String)

    getBooleanProperty

    public static boolean getBooleanProperty(java.lang.String key)
    Get a boolean runtime property from the property cache. The property is true if its string value is "true" or "yes" when compared in a case-insensitive way. The property is false if it has any other value, or is not set at all. In other respects, this method works like getProperty.

    Parameters:
    key - The name of the property to be looked up.
    Returns:
    The property value.
    See Also:
    Configuration.getBooleanProperty(String, boolean)

    getBooleanProperty

    public static boolean getBooleanProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                         boolean nominatedDefaultValue)
    Get a boolean runtime property from the cache, with the option to revert to a nominated default value if the requested property has not been set.

    Parameters:
    key - The name of the property to be looked up.
    nominatedDefaultValue - The default to use if this property was not explicitly set.
    Returns:
    The value of the property, or the nominated default if the property was not explicitly set.

    getIntProperty

    public static java.lang.Integer getIntProperty(java.lang.String key)
                                        throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
    Get an integer runtime property from the property cache. null is returned if the property is not specified, otherwise it returns the specified integer value. If the property is non integral, a NumberFormatException is thrown. In other respects, this method works like getProperty.

    Parameters:
    key - The name of the property to be looked up.
    Returns:
    The property value.
    Throws:
    java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the property is specified, but is not an integer.
    See Also:
    Configuration.getProperty(String)

    setProperty

    public static void setProperty(java.lang.String key,
                               java.lang.String value)
    Sets a runtime property. If the property is set to null or empty it will be removed from the cache. This method is not thread safe and is only available for testing purposes.

    Parameters:
    key - The name of the property to be set.
    value - The value the property should be set to.
    See Also:
    Configuration.getProperty(String)

    getJMSLiteBindingLocation

    public static java.lang.String getJMSLiteBindingLocation()
    Get the binding file location for jmslite, if no bindings file location is specified in bootstrap.

    Returns:
    binding file location path string.

    updateStaticProperty

    public static void updateStaticProperty(java.lang.String fileLocation,
                                        java.lang.String propertyToUpdate,
                                        java.lang.String value)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
    Updates any static property value in any property file. if property already found - update if not found - add.

    Parameters:
    fileLocation - location of property file.
    propertyToUpdate - property name to update.
    value - new value to update.
    Throws:
    java.lang.Exception - exception is thrown if failed to read property file.

    getProperty

    public static java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                           java.lang.String propertyFileName)
    Get a runtime property from a file. Only the specified properties file is searched for the property specified. Properties within the file are not cached and the method always returns the associated value of the property key stored in the specified property file at the time of the invocation of this method.

    Parameters:
    key - The name of the property to be looked up
    propertyFileName - The name of the property file to be searched. The format of the the property file name is the same as for java.util.ResourceBundle.
    Returns:
    The property value with white space trimmed from the left and right hand side. Null is returned if the property does not exist, or if it exists but has nothing assigned to it.
    See Also:
    Configuration.setProperty(String, String)

    getBooleanProperty

    public static boolean getBooleanProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                         boolean nominatedDefaultValue,
                                         java.lang.String propertyFileName)
    Get a boolean runtime property from the specified property file, with the option to revert to a nominated default value if the requested property has not been set.

    Parameters:
    key - The name of the property to be looked up.
    nominatedDefaultValue - The default to use if this property was not explicitly set.
    propertyFileName - The name of the property file to be searched if the key is not found in the system properties. The format of the property file name is the same as for java.util.ResourceBundle .
    Returns:
    The value of the property, or the nominated default if the property was not explicitly set.

    getIntProperty

    public static java.lang.Integer getIntProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                               java.lang.String propertyFileName)
                                        throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
    Get an integer runtime property from the specified property file. Null is returned if the property is not specified, otherwise it is the specified Integer value. If the property is non integral, a NumberFormatException is thrown. In other respects, this method works like getProperty.

    Parameters:
    key - The name of the property to be looked up.
    propertyFileName - The name of the property file to be searched if the key is not found in the system properties. The format of the the property file name is the same as for java.util.ResourceBundle .
    Returns:
    The property value.
    Throws:
    java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the property is specified, but is not an integer.
    See Also:
    Configuration.getProperty(String, String)

    isHashUpgradeEnabled

    public static boolean isHashUpgradeEnabled()
    is password hash Upgrade enabled.

    Returns:
    The value of the property, or default false is returned.
